title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.6 - Taxi-concession
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.6 - Taxi-concession

State Regulations
(a) General system. Taxicab concessionaire shall operate from passenger loading, unloading and
staging areas as designated by the airport manager. Authorized taxicabs will
progress through the staging areas and passenger loading/unloading areas to
depart the airport. (b) Privileges
granted. Taxicab concessionaire is provided the privilege of an exclusive right
to solicit passengers for taxicab service from the airport, to any and all
points outside the airport area. However, the solicitation of passengers is
prohibited inside the terminal building. (c) Taxicab operation requirements. (1)

Starter responsibility. The
concessionaire agrees to provide a "starter" who will be available to furnish
service to the airport passengers at the time of all scheduled flight arrivals
(including changes in schedules) of the various airlines. In addition, the
starter will be responsible for the following: (i) insuring the smooth, orderly loading and
departure of the taxicabs; (ii)
maintaining order in the designated taxi staging areas and loading/unloading
areas; (iii)
insure taxicabs are
provided trips on a random, nonpreferential basis; (iv)
direct patrons to alternative forms of
transportation if requested; (v) advise patrons of authorized rates, if requested; and
(vi)
balance taxi service at both the east
and west terminal buildings. (d) Fees and charges. As stipulated in the
executed concession agreement between the NFTA and the taxicab
concessionaire. Notes

1160.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
